definition: to be absent from work or school

sentences.english: He took my place during my absence.
sentences.chinese: 在我缺勤期間他代替了我。

sentences.english: The boss discharged her because of her absence.
sentences.chinese: 老闆因她缺勤而把她解僱了。

sentences.english: The consecutive period of time that a payee is absent from work for the same reason.
sentences.chinese: 受款人因同一原因而缺勤的持續時間。

sentences.english: You can define specific plausibility checks for the entry of attendances and absences .
sentences.chinese: 你可以對輸入的出勤和缺勤做特別的核對。

sentences.english: I guess you'll need me to forecast employee absences as well, right?
sentences.chinese: 我猜您也需要我預測員工的缺勤率對吧？

sentences.english: Ueported absence will give rise to salary deduction and disciplinary punishment.
sentences.chinese: 無故缺勤和擅自離崗將導致扣發工資和紀律處分。

sentences.english: Students must bring a note for a parent explaining any absence or tardiness.
sentences.chinese: 任何缺勤或遲到，需要出示家長寫的請假條。

sentences.english: Unreported absence will give rise to salary deduction and disciplinary punishment.
sentences.chinese: 無故缺勤和擅自離崗將導致扣發工資和紀律處分。

sentences.english: You have missed several attendances this term.
sentences.chinese: 這學期你已缺勤好幾次了。

definition: to go to work/to be present (at work, school etc)/to be away on business
to leave early (before the stipulated finishing time)/to retire early (from one's job)
to check attendance (at school or workplace)/to monitor efficiency (of workers)
leave of absence for a personal matter
to take time off/to take leave (e.g. for study)/to skive off work
to delay handing over (payment, homework etc)
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
to give classes/to work as a teacher
to shift holidays, taking a weekday off
